articles.title: A 'throwback' to Man Utd's past, defensive chaos and a classic
articles.summary: A remarkable, chaotic, mesmerising Premier League thriller at Old Trafford between Manchester United and Bournemouth captures the imagination of all those present - even the two head coaches.

articles.title: Man Utd midfielder's half-brother wears 'Free Kobbie Mainoo' T-shirt
articles.summary: A T-shirt worn by Kobbie Mainoo's half-brother was among the post-match talking points at Old Trafford - even after a game as thrilling as the 4-4 draw between Manchester United and Bournemouth.

articles.title: Where does Old Trafford thriller rank among best Premier League games?
articles.summary: Manchester United and Bournemouth played out a rollercoaster 4-4 draw at Old Trafford on Monday. But where does it rank among the greatest games in Premier League history?

articles.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
articles.summary: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

articles.title: Can you name every nation at Afcon 2025?
articles.summary: With the Africa Cup of Nations kicking off on Sunday, 21 December, can you name all the teams involved at this year's tournament?

articles.title: Man City to target Guehi in summer - Tuesday's gossip
articles.summary: Manchester City will target Marc Guehi next summer, three Premier League clubs are eyeing Daniel Munoz, Manchester United will try to sign Conor Gallagher in January, plus more.

articles.title: Watch Man Utd and Bournemouth's eight-goal thriller
articles.summary: Bournemouth's Junior Kroupi scores the equaliser in a dramatic 4-4 draw against Manchester United at Old Trafford, after two quick-fire goals from United's Bruno Fernandes and Matheus Cunha put the ho...

articles.title: Maresca 'happy' at Chelsea but wounds remain open
articles.summary: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca is evasive when asked to explain his claim that he has endured his "worst 48 hours" at the club and lacked support.

articles.title: What fans, insiders and stats say about embattled Frank
articles.summary: Tottenham have lost as many league games as they have won this season under Thomas Frank, with some fans criticising his style of play. BBC Sport assesses Spurs' struggles under their new manager.

articles.title: Amorim 'really disappointed' to draw 'fun game'
articles.summary: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim says his team "lost two points" in a helter-skelter 4-4 Premier League draw against Bournemouth. United led three times but had to settle for a point.

articles.title: A lot of positives for Bournemouth in draw - Iraola
articles.summary: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola says his team can take positives from their 4-4 draw at Manchester United, but that there are also "some things to correct" from the performance.

articles.title: O'Neill 'would happily have stayed on' at Celtic
articles.summary: Martin O'Neill says he would "happily have stayed on" as Celtic manager after his interim spell ended with seven wins out of eight games.

articles.title: Rodgers close to joining Saudi club Al-Qadsiah
articles.summary: Brendan Rodgers is set to be appointed as manager of Saudi Pro League side Al-Qadsiah.

articles.title: Should Gomez have been sent off for tackle on Wirtz?
articles.summary: Premier League VARs continue have a problem with red cards. And Diego Gomez's tackle on Florian Wirtz shows it.

articles.title: 'The sky is the limit' - the resurgence of Calvert-Lewin
articles.summary: Since the Premier League returned in mid-November the Englishman has been on a mission, netting four goals in five games.

articles.title: Whitlock rediscovers Ally Pally magic but loses thriller to Scutt
articles.summary: Simon Whitlock recaptured some of his old Alexandra Palace magic, despite the 2010 runner-up and three-time semi-finalist ultimately losing a thriller 3-2 to Connor Scutt in the first round of th...

articles.title: Infamous Ally Pally wasp plays starring role at World Darts Championship - but why?
articles.summary: Defending champion Luke Littler, and some of darts' biggest names, have been firmly upstaged over the opening week of the World Darts Championship - by a wasp!

articles.title: Benin have point to prove at Afcon after World Cup pain
articles.summary: Benin arrive at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco looking to turn 2026 World Cup qualification heartbreak into a memorable continental campaign.
